required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Broccoli Sprout Dose Response: Bioavailability and Effects of Air Pollutants
clinical_study.official_title: Broccoli Sprout Dose Response: Bioavailability and Effects on Air Pollutants

lead_sponsor.agency: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

clinical_study.source: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the extent to which lower doses of a broccoli-derived beverage enhance the detoxication of air pollutants excreted in urine as compared to an maximal dose shown to be effective previously.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a 10-day placebo control Phase II broccoli sprout intervention to be conducted in Qidong, P.R. China. Up to twelve hundred people from the farming townships will be screened and one hundred seventy eligible individuals will be enrolled in the study. Participants will be randomized into 4 treatment groups: one will receive a juice beverage containing a standard dose of glucoraphanin- and sulforaphane-rich broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water, the second will receive one-half dose, the third one-fifth dose and the fourth group will receive placebo beverage containing pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Participants will drink their assigned beverage every evening and provide consecutive 12-hour urine collections throughout the duration of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Sulforaphane Bioavailability Measured in Sequential 12-Hour Urine Samples
primary_outcome.description: Urinary excretion of broccoli-derived sulforaphane metabolites: sulforaphane-mercapturic acid. The metabolites were measured all 20 of the sequential 12-hour urine collections from each participant over the 10-day intervention period. Data from each individual were summed to provide a single "per 24-hours" value for each participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modulation of Air Pollutant Excretion in Sequential Overnight 12-Hour Urine Samples
secondary_outcome.description: Benzene-mercapturic acid (SPMA) excretion was measured in the sequential overnight 12-hour urine samples collected across the 10-day study period. Data from each individual were summed and averaged to provide a single "per 12-hours" value for each participant.

arm_group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days.
Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (600 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (40 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days.
Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (300 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (20 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days.
Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (120 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (8 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days.

intervention.description: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebos.
Placebo as comparison to broccoli sprout-derived beverages

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- in good general health with no history of chronic illness
- normal liver function tests
- normal renal function tests
Exclusion Criteria:
- personal history of cancer except for non-melanoma skin cancer
- use of prescribed medicines
- for women, a positive pregnancy test

overall_official.affiliation: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

reference.citation: Egner PA, Chen JG, Zarth AT, Ng DK, Wang JB, Kensler KH, Jacobson LP, Mu√±oz A, Johnson JL, Groopman JD, Fahey JW, Talalay P, Zhu J, Chen TY, Qian GS, Carmella SG, Hecht SS, Kensler TW. Rapid and sustainable detoxication of airborne pollutants by broccoli sprout beverage: results of a randomized clinical trial in China. Cancer Prev Res (Phila). 2014 Aug;7(8):813-823. doi: 10.1158/1940-6207.CAPR-14-0103. Epub 2014 Jun 9.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (600 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (40 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Sulforaphane Bioavailability Measured in Sequential 12-Hour Urine Samples
outcome.description: Urinary excretion of broccoli-derived sulforaphane metabolites: sulforaphane-mercapturic acid. The metabolites were measured all 20 of the sequential 12-hour urine collections from each participant over the 10-day intervention period. Data from each individual were summed to provide a single "per 24-hours" value for each participant.
outcome.population: Placebo arm samples were not analyzed f because no sulforaphane was administered to this group. Historically, background levels from dietary sources in this population are very low compared to active intervention levels. In addition, one participant in the High Dose Broccoli Sprout arm did not complete the full protocol and was not included.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (600 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (40 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (300 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (20 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. measure.title: Sulforaphane Bioavailability Measured in Sequential 12-Hour Urine Samples
measure.description: Urinary excretion of broccoli-derived sulforaphane metabolites: sulforaphane-mercapturic acid. The metabolites were measured all 20 of the sequential 12-hour urine collections from each participant over the 10-day intervention period. Data from each individual were summed to provide a single "per 24-hours" value for each participant.
measure.population: Placebo arm samples were not analyzed f because no sulforaphane was administered to this group. Historically, background levels from dietary sources in this population are very low compared to active intervention levels. In addition, one participant in the High Dose Broccoli Sprout arm did not complete the full protocol and was not included.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that the urinary sulforaphane levels are equal across treatment arms. Sulforaphane metabolite levels were measured daily for 10 days in each arm.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Statistical significance of the treatment effect (p < 0.01) for the lower doses compared to the high dose as the reference.
analysis.p_value_desc: Using a linear mixed effects model with random intercepts and slope, SF level (in the log scale) was regressed on categorical treatment group (medium dose and low dose; high as the reference) as well as day (continuous variable).

outcome.title: Modulation of Air Pollutant Excretion in Sequential Overnight 12-Hour Urine Samples
outcome.description: Benzene-mercapturic acid (SPMA) excretion was measured in the sequential overnight 12-hour urine samples collected across the 10-day study period. Data from each individual were summed and averaged to provide a single "per 12-hours" value for each participant.
outcome.population: Due to irreversible failure of the mass spectrometer used in this analysis, not all urine samples were evaluated for SPMA levels. Only individuals for whom all 10 samples were collected and analyzed are included in this summary (132/169).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.title: Low Dose Broccoli Sprout
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (120 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (8 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.title: Medium Dose Broccoli Sprout
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (300 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (20 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

group.title: High Dose Broccoli Sprout
group.description: Beverage (100 mL) containing glucoraphanin-rich (600 micromole) and sulforaphane-rich (40 micromole) broccoli sprout powder mixed in pineapple juice, lime juice and water. Nightly for 10 days. Broccoli Sprout Powder: Maximum, half and one-fifth doses of broccoli sprout-derived beverage compared to placebo.

measure.title: Modulation of Air Pollutant Excretion in Sequential Overnight 12-Hour Urine Samples
measure.description: Benzene-mercapturic acid (SPMA) excretion was measured in the sequential overnight 12-hour urine samples collected across the 10-day study period. Data from each individual were summed and averaged to provide a single "per 12-hours" value for each participant.
measure.population: Due to irreversible failure of the mass spectrometer used in this analysis, not all urine samples were evaluated for SPMA levels. Only individuals for whom all 10 samples were collected and analyzed are included in this summary (132/169).

analysis.groups_desc: All broccoli sprout arms were compared with the placebo arm.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: To summarize first 12-hour SPMA levels over the study course by participant, the SPMA geometric mean (in the log scale) for each individual was calculated and used as the outcome. Treatment arms (placebo, fifth, half and full doses) were independent (categorical) variables in a linear regression model with placebo as the reference.
analysis.estimate_desc: This Estimation Parameter was based on the comparison between the full dose group and the placebo group.

reported_events.time_frame: Daily during the course of the 10-day study and again 1 week after completion of the study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
